name: Shango
title: The God of Thunder, Lightning, and Fire

core_identity.domain: Thunder, Lightning, Fire, Justice, War, Power

about_section.title: The Storm King and Divine Warrior
about_section.description: Shango is the mighty Orisha of thunder and lightning, known for his immense power, passion, and justice.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: With his fiery energy, Shango commands storms and lightning, enforcing divine justice and leading warriors into battle.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Shango is widely revered in the Yoruba religion and diaspora faiths, including **Santer√≠a and Candombl√©**, where his dance and rituals invoke divine energy.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: While Shango shares powerful bonds with **Oya** and **Eleggua**, his pride sometimes puts him at odds with other Orishas, such as **Obatala**.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: His **Double-Bladed Axe** represents his mastery over war and lightning, the **Thunderstones** channel his energy, and the **Dance of Fire** symbolizes his commanding presence.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Shango inspires warriors, rulers, and dancers, embodying the spirit of strength, charisma, and resilience.

legends: ‚ö° The King of Oyo: Before ascending to divinity, Shango was a powerful king whose fiery rule shaped Yoruba history.
üî• The Wrath of Shango: His anger calls forth storms, striking down those who act unjustly.
üåÄ The Love of Oya: Oya, the goddess of winds and storms, became Shango‚Äôs greatest ally and counterpart in power.
üå© The Legacy of the Thunderstones: Shango‚Äôs followers believe his divine energy is left behind in lightning-struck stones.
lore: üî± The Double-Bladed Axe: A sacred weapon symbolizing his ability to rule both war and justice.
‚ö° Thunderstones: Believed to contain his divine energy, granting protection and strength.
üî• The Dance of Fire: Shango‚Äôs movements are said to call forth fire and lightning, blessing his devotees with power and charisma.

name: Olodumare
title: The Supreme Creator, The Source of All Existence

core_identity.domain: Creation, Omnipotence, Destiny, Balance, Universal Order

about_section.title: The Supreme Creator and Universal Order
about_section.description: Olodumare is the ultimate, transcendent force in Yoruba cosmology, beyond human comprehension, shaping all reality and existence.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: Unlike other deities, Olodumare does not intervene in worldly affairs but grants Ase‚Äîthe divine power of existence‚Äîto the Orisha.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Olodumare is not directly worshipped but is honored through prayers and rituals invoking the Orisha, who act as intermediaries.

about_section.title: Allies & Divine Delegation
about_section.description: Olodumare entrusted Orunmila with wisdom, Obatala with creation, and the Orisha with various aspects of life to maintain balance.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **Ase of Creation** represents divine authority, the **Cosmic Breath** animates all life, and the **Divine Knowledge** contains the mysteries of the universe.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: While Olodumare does not directly interact with mortals, all prayers, rituals, and destinies ultimately flow back to the Supreme Creator.

legends: üåç The Gift of Ase: Olodumare granted the power of creation and transformation to the Orisha, allowing them to shape existence.
‚òÄ The Birth of the Universe: Olodumare breathed life into the void, giving rise to the heavens, earth, and all living things.
üìú The Balance of Fate: Olodumare inscribed the destinies of all beings, allowing free will while maintaining cosmic balance.
‚ú® The Unseen Presence: Unlike the Orisha, Olodumare does not take form but exists beyond time, space, and perception.
lore: üìú The Ase of Creation: The divine force that governs existence, enabling deities and mortals to shape their fates.
üåû The Cosmic Breath: The essence of life itself, flowing through all living beings and celestial bodies.
üîÆ The Divine Knowledge: A sacred wisdom that only Orunmila, the Orisha of wisdom, can fully comprehend.

name: Obatala
title: The Orisha of Wisdom, Purity, and Creation

about_section.title: The Divine Sculptor of Humanity
about_section.description: Obatala, the eldest Orisha, was chosen by Olodumare to shape human beings from sacred clay, instilling wisdom and purity in them.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: As the Orisha of wisdom and justice, Obatala ensures fairness, encourages patience, and promotes inner peace among both deities and mortals.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Obatala is honored across the Yoruba world, particularly by those seeking guidance, healing, and spiritual clarity.

about_section.title: Allies & Divine Harmony
about_section.description: Obatala is closely linked to Olodumare, Orunmila, and other Orisha of wisdom, standing in opposition to forces of disorder and recklessness.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **White Cloth of Purity** represents his wisdom and clarity, the **Clay of Creation** symbolizes his role as humanity‚Äôs sculptor, and the **Crown of Peace** embodies his divine rule.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Obatala continues to guide mortals through dreams, visions, and acts of divine intervention, teaching them patience, justice, and the importance of inner purity.

legends: üè∫ The Creation of Humanity: Tasked by Olodumare, Obatala sculpted the first human beings from clay, giving them life and purpose.

‚òÅ The Drunken Mistake: In one myth, Obatala accidentally created some individuals imperfectly after drinking palm wine, leading to the existence of those with disabilities, whom he deeply cherishes.
‚öñ The Keeper of Peace: Obatala is often invoked to mediate disputes and restore balance in times of conflict.
üå¨ The Breath of Life: It is said that Obatala whispers wisdom into the ears of those who seek knowledge and enlightenment.
lore: üåÄ The White Cloth of Purity: Symbolizes Obatala‚Äôs untainted wisdom and the importance of self-control.
üè∫ The Clay of Creation: The divine material from which he shaped the first humans.
üëë The Crown of Peace: A sacred artifact that represents his authority over wisdom and justice.

name: Oshun
title: The Goddess of Love, Beauty, and Rivers

core_identity.domain: Love, Beauty, Fertility, Water, Prosperity, Healing

about_section.title: The Divine Enchantress and Healer
about_section.description: Oshun is the Orisha of love, beauty, and fertility, known for her deep compassion, irresistible charm, and boundless generosity.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: Oshun governs all bodies of fresh water, healing the sick, bestowing prosperity, and guiding lovers with her divine wisdom.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Oshun is honored in Yoruba and diaspora traditions, particularly during the **Oshun Festival in Oshogbo**, where devotees seek her blessings for love and abundance.

about_section.title: Allies & Divine Balance
about_section.description: She works alongside **Obatala** and **Yemaya**, yet she has a fiery passion that sometimes leads to conflicts with the other Orisha.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **Golden Mirror** symbolizes self-love and inner beauty, the **Waters of Healing** bring fertility and vitality, and the **Dance of Seduction** represents her ability to charm and influence.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Oshun remains one of the most beloved Orisha, inspiring music, dance, and rituals dedicated to love, abundance, and self-empowerment.

legends: üíß The Tears of Oshun: When the Orisha neglected her, she wept until the rivers dried, showing that love and beauty are necessary for life.
üåä The Healing Waters: She saved humanity by purifying the rivers, ensuring fertility and abundance.
üé∂ The Seduction of Shango: Using her charm and dance, she won the heart of the fiery thunder god.
üåü The Golden River: It is said that the glimmering waters of Oshun‚Äôs sacred river are touched by divine gold.
lore: üåø The Golden Mirror: A symbol of self-reflection, beauty, and divine charm.
üíß The Waters of Healing: Sacred waters believed to grant fertility, love, and spiritual cleansing.
üé∂ The Dance of Seduction: Oshun‚Äôs ability to sway hearts and bring harmony through movement and song.

name: Ogun
title: The God of Iron, War, and Craftsmanship

core_identity.domain: Iron, War, Hunting, Blacksmithing, Labor, Strength

about_section.title: The Divine Blacksmith and Warrior
about_section.description: Ogun is the Orisha of iron and war, embodying the strength, skill, and determination needed to forge weapons, tools, and destinies.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: Ogun‚Äôs mastery over iron makes him the patron of warriors, hunters, and craftsmen, giving them the power to shape and defend their world.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Ogun is revered in Yoruba culture and the African diaspora, particularly by blacksmiths, soldiers, and laborers seeking his protection and strength.

about_section.title: Allies & Divine Balance
about_section.description: He often works alongside **Orunmila** and **Ochosi**, but his fierce nature sometimes clashes with Orisha like **Shango**.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **Iron Blade** represents his role as a warrior, the **Forge Hammer** symbolizes craftsmanship, and the **Sacred Forest** is his divine home.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Ogun grants strength and perseverance to those who work hard, fight for justice, and respect the power of metal and fire.

legends: ‚öî The First Blacksmith: Ogun was the first to forge tools and weapons, teaching humanity how to work with iron.
üî• The Blood Oath of Ogun: He once swore an oath that no coward would ever wield his weapons without consequence.
üå≥ The Warrior Who Became a God: After leading many battles, Ogun disappeared into the sacred forest, ascending to divinity.
üõ† The Builder of Civilization: Ogun‚Äôs iron tools allowed cities and roads to be built, shaping the foundations of society.
lore: ‚öî The Iron Blade: A sacred weapon used for protection, battle, and justice.
üõ† The Forge Hammer: A tool of creation, symbolizing Ogun‚Äôs craftsmanship and labor.
üå≥ The Sacred Forest: A mystical place where Ogun's spirit resides, offering strength to those who seek him.

core_identity.domain: Trickery, Crossroads, Fate, Chaos, Communication, Balance

about_section.title: The Trickster and Keeper of Balance
about_section.description: Esu is the divine trickster and messenger of the Orisha, ensuring balance by guiding and testing mortals and spirits alike.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: Esu has the power to manipulate fate, deliver messages between worlds, and challenge individuals to choose their paths wisely.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Revered across the Yoruba world and diaspora, Esu is honored in ceremonies where he is called upon to open the roads to success, fortune, and destiny.

about_section.title: Allies & Divine Role
about_section.description: Though sometimes seen as a troublemaker, Esu plays an essential role in maintaining cosmic balance, working closely with **Orunmila** and **Ogun**.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **Crossroads Staff** represents decision-making and transformation, the **Mask of Duality** reflects his ever-changing nature, and the **Divine Words** carry the power of fate.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Esu frequently appears at crucial moments in people's lives, offering choices, challenges, and riddles that shape their destinies.

legends: üõ§ The Guardian of the Crossroads: Esu ensures that every traveler and seeker must make a choice that determines their fate.
üé≠ The Trickster‚Äôs Lessons: He often tests mortals and Orisha alike, teaching wisdom through chaos and mischief.
üî• The Messenger of the Gods: Esu carries prayers and offerings between the human and divine realms, ensuring balance in the universe.
‚öñ The Keeper of Duality: As a being of both order and chaos, he ensures that neither side ever dominates the other.
lore: üõ§ The Crossroads Staff: A mystical staff that guides travelers and seekers toward their destined paths.
üé≠ The Mask of Duality: Symbolizing his ever-changing nature, appearing both as a benevolent guide and a mischievous trickster.
üî• The Divine Words: Esu's speech can shape reality, influencing fate, destiny, and cosmic order.
